@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.array.u.name: unique
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.array.u.description: This function will return a filtered array without any duplicated

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.name: querySelectorLive
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.description:
Observe the dom to get all the elements that matches a passed css selector at any point in time.
Be warned that this use the mutation observer API and will monitor all the document for new nodes. Make sure to use it
when you don't have the chance to use the custom elements API instead

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Global reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Destyle reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Sugar reset
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Checkbox

example.title: solid
example.code:

    <input type="checkbox" checked class="s-checkbox" name="checkbox-style-solid-1" value="hello 1" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    I'm disabled
    <input type="checkbox" disabled class="s-checkbox s-color:accent" name="checkbox-style-solid-3" value="hello 3" />
  </label>

example.title: Colors (none-exhaustive)
example.code:
<label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    Internal Interactions Administrator Hilda Kreiger Jr.
    <input type="checkbox" class="s-checkbox s-color:accent" name="checkbox-style-color-2" value="hello 2" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    National Creative Planner Wilson D'Amore
    <input type="checkbox" class="s-checkbox s-color:complementary" name="checkbox-style-color-3" value="hello 3" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    I'm disabled
    <input type="checkbox" disabled class="s-checkbox s-color:error" name="checkbox-style-color-4" value="hello 4" />
  </label>

example.title: default
example.code:
<label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    District Intranet Manager Craig Olson
    <input type="checkbox" checked class="s-checkbox:default" name="checkbox-shape-default-1" value="hello 1" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    I'm disabled
    <input type="checkbox" disabled class="s-checkbox:default" name="checkbox-shape-default-3" value="hello 3" />
  </label>

example.title: square
example.code:

    International Solutions Designer Rachel Prohaska
    <input type="checkbox" checked class="s-checkbox:square" name="checkbox-shape-square-1" value="hello 1" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    I'm disabled
    <input type="checkbox" disabled class="s-checkbox:square" name="checkbox-shape-square-3" value="hello 3" />
  </label>

example.title: circle
example.code:
<label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">
    International Marketing Analyst Karla Roberts
    <input type="checkbox" checked class="s-checkbox:circle" name="checkbox-shape-circle-1" value="hello 1" />
  </label>
  <label class="s-mbe:30 s-label">

  </label>

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Typography
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

example.title: code:not(pre > code)
example.code:
<code:not(pre > code) class="s-typo:code:not(pre > code)">
      Emanuel Bashirian
  </code:not(pre > code)>

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Fit Sizes
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: s-fit:fill
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>fill</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: s-fit:cover
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>cover</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>contain</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: s-fit:none
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>none</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Format text
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
This class allows you to apply some formatting to pure HTMLElement that are scoped into.
For example, a simple `ul` tag will be styled as if the `s-list:ul` class would be applied on it
when it is scoped inside the `s-format:text` class.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.format.text` mixin on the elements you
want to support the text formatting.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Offsize
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

example.title: All around
Block

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Scale
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

example.code:
Scale 10

Mr. Jermaine Swift

Scale 11

Guy Douglas

Scale 12

Alicia Mills

Scale 13

Rochelle Rempel

Scale 14

Laverne Von

Scale 15

Sammy Bogan

Scale 16

Hugh Dickinson I

Scale 17

Dr. Timmy Herzog

Scale 18

Ms. Edgar Morar

Scale 19

Jane Murazik

Scale 20

Louis Daugherty

Scale default

Samuel Hoppe

Scale 01

Louise Grimes

Scale 02

Shawna Kreiger

Scale 03

Miss Sonja Kling

Scale 04

Eric Stamm

Scale 05

Sherri Terry

Scale 06

Maryann Hand

Scale 07

Dixie Lind

Scale 08

Richard Heathcote MD

Scale 09

Ray Frami

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: s-scale:10
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>10</yellow>" scale style to any HTMLElement.
Note that this scale is not applied using the "transform" property but it will scale
all the properties that uses the function "sugar.scalable" to set his value.

example.code:
I'm a cool title

I'm a cool scaled title

since 2.0.0

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.name: Icons
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.styl.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

s-blockquote.name: s-blockquote
